summary.para: Get a pointer to a variable that contains rasterizer state.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of rasterizer-state descriptions. If there is only one rasterizer variable in the effect, use 0.

param.name: pRasterizerDesc
param.para: A pointer to a rasterizer-state description (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. Backing store data can used to recreate the variable when necessary.

summary.para: Get a pointer to a rasterizer interface.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of rasterizer interfaces. If there is only one rasterizer interface, use 0.

param.name: ppRasterizerState
param.para: The address of a pointer to a rasterizer interface (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: A rasterizer-variable interface accesses rasterizer state.

remarks.para: An ID3D10EffectRasterizerVariable Interface is created when an effect is read into memory.

Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. You can use either of these methods to return state. For examples, see Two Ways to Get the State in an Effect Variable.
